pages.text: The Ritual of Serenity creates a peaceful zone where hostile mobs cannot naturally spawn. This ritual prevents natural mob spawning within a configurable radius around the master ritual stone, providing a safe haven for your base or work area.$(br2)Note: Mob spawners are not affected and will continue to function normally.

pages.title: How It Works
pages.text: When active, the ritual prevents hostile mob spawning in a 48-block radius (configurable) around the ritual stone.$(br2)The ritual consumes LP continuously:$(br)- 50 LP per tick (default)$(br)- Checked every second (20 ticks)$(br)- Total: 1000 LP per second at default settings

pages.title: Deactivation
pages.text: The ritual will automatically stop if:$(br)- Insufficient LP in the network$(br)- The ritual is manually stopped$(br)- A redstone signal is applied to the master ritual stone$(br2)When the ritual stops, mob spawning will resume normally in the area. The effect is immediate and does not persist after deactivation.

pages.title: Configuration
pages.text: The Ritual of Serenity can be configured via the server config:$(br)- Spawn Prevention Radius: Radius in blocks (default: 48, range: 1-256)$(br)- LP Per Tick: LP cost per tick (default: 50, range: 1-10000)$(br2)Activation Cost: 10000 LP$(br2)Note: The radius is measured in blocks from the master ritual stone.

pages.title: Ritual Structure
pages.text: The Ritual of Serenity uses a peaceful pattern with 4 Water runes (representing calm), 4 Air runes (representing tranquility), and 4 Earth runes (for grounding). This creates a balanced and harmonious structure.

pages.title: Performance Note
pages.text: At default settings, this ritual consumes 1000 LP per second (60,000 LP per minute). This is more economical than the Aeternum Vivere ritual, making it suitable for long-term use.$(br2)The ritual is ideal for protecting your base from hostile mob spawns while you work on other projects. Combine it with other defensive measures for complete protection.
